gameEntity.name: Barbarian
gameEntity.description: A fierce warrior of a primitive background who can enter a battle rage

gameEntity.name: Starting equipment: items - martial melee weapon
Starting equipment: items - any simple weapon
Starting equipment: items - explorer's pack and four javelins. Not really an option
Rage
gameEntity.description:
On your turn, you can enter a rage as a bonus action. While raging, you gain the following benefits if you aren't wearing heavy armor:
You have advantage on all Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
When you make a melee weapon attack using Strength, you gain a bonus to the damage roll that increases as you gain levels as a barbarian, as shown in the Rage Damage column of the Barbarian table.
You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

If you are able to cast spells, you can't cast them or concentrate on them while raging.
Your rage lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if you are knocked unconscious or if your turn ends and you haven't attacked a hostile creature since your last turn or taken damage since then. You can also end your rage on your turn as a bonus action.
Once you have raged the number of times shown for your barbarian level in the Rages column of the Barbarian table, you must finish a long rest before you can rage again.

gameEntity.name: Unarmored Defense
gameEntity.description: While you are not wearing any armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Constitution modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

extraLevelColumns.name: rages
extraLevelColumns.description: The number of rages that can be done between long rests

extraLevelColumns.name: rage damage
extraLevelColumns.description: Bonus to damage when raged

gameEntity.name: Reckless Attack
gameEntity.description: Starting at 2nd level, when you make your first attack on your turn, you can decide to attack recklessly. Doing so gives you advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls using Strength during that turn, but attack rolls against you are rolled with advantage until the beginning of your next turn.

gameEntity.name: Danger Sense
gameEntity.description: At 2nd level, you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects that you can see, such as traps or spells. You do not gain this benefit if you are blinded, deafened, or incapacitated.

extraLevelColumns.description: The number of rages that can be done between long rests

gameEntity.name: Extra Attack
gameEntity.description: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

gameEntity.name: Fast Movement
gameEntity.description: Starting at 5th level, your speed increases by 10 feet while you aren't wearing heavy armor.
